    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Looks like the steps are:<span class="line"><!---->Looks like the steps are:<!----></span><br>1. Load chrome://accessibility<span class="line"><!---->1. Load chrome://accessibility<!----></span><br>2. Check  web accessibility<span class="line"><!---->2. Check  web accessibility<!----></span><br>3. Rapidly repeatedly toggle the native a11y API support checkbox <span class="line"><!---->3. Rapidly repeatedly toggle the native a11y API support checkbox <!----></span><br><br>It doesn't make a lot of sense to consider chrome:// crashes as actual security vulnerabilities.<span class="line"><!---->It doesn't make a lot of sense to consider chrome:// crashes as actual security vulnerabilities.<!----></span><br>You can't inject code into them, link to them from another page, or load them remotely. A user would have to manually go to that page themselves.<span class="line"><!---->You can't inject code into them, link to them from another page, or load them remotely. A user would have to manually go to that page themselves.<!----></span><br><br>That said, thanks for the bug and we will address by having it manually force a safe crash in this case (where the a11y messaging system gets confused).<span class="line"><!---->That said, thanks for the bug and we will address by having it manually force a safe crash in this case (where the a11y messaging system gets confused).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again.         We consider browser process use-after-free to be Critical, but if it requires "unusual or unlikely user interaction" we consider the severity to be mitigated down by one or two levels. I'm therefore going to rate this Security_Severity-Medium.<span class="line"><!---->We consider browser process use-after-free to be Critical, but if it requires "unusual or unlikely user interaction" we consider the severity to be mitigated down by one or two levels. I'm therefore going to rate this Security_Severity-Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, this reward amount was not determine solely because there was no POC or reproduction, but also because <span class="line"><!---->Hello, this reward amount was not determine solely because there was no POC or reproduction, but also because <!----></span><br>1) this bug does not appear to be reachable from the web and triggering it would require considerable amount of UI gesture<span class="line"><!---->1) this bug does not appear to be reachable from the web and triggering it would require considerable amount of UI gesture<!----></span><br>2) the amount of UI gesture is quite exception and unusable, the chances of an attacker convincing a user to engage with the UI in this way to exploit this bug seem very low <span class="line"><!---->2) the amount of UI gesture is quite exception and unusable, the chances of an attacker convincing a user to engage with the UI in this way to exploit this bug seem very low <!----></span><br>3) there would be very limited attacker control to exploit this issue, so with the very low exploitability potential, the reward extended is much lower<span class="line"><!---->3) there would be very limited attacker control to exploit this issue, so with the very low exploitability potential, the reward extended is much lower<!----></span><br><br>If you can provide a POC that displays a way to trigger and exploit this issue without exception UI gesture and demonstrate greater control of this vulnerability, we would be happy to revisit this issue and reassess the reward amount.<span class="line"><!---->If you can provide a POC that displays a way to trigger and exploit this issue without exception UI gesture and demonstrate greater control of this vulnerability, we would be happy to revisit this issue and reassess the reward amount.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

Surkov &lt;<!----></span>asurkov@igalia.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asurkov@igalia.com"><!---->asurkov@igalia.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: content::BrowserAccessibilityManager dependency in UIA event<!----></span><br>recorder.<span class="line"><!---->recorder.<!----></span><br><br>Besides it allows to ship ax_dump tools with no content dependency, it<span class="line"><!---->Besides it allows to ship ax_dump tools with no content dependency, it<!----></span><br>also helps to avoid bugs like<span class="line"><!---->also helps to avoid bugs like<!----></span><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270095<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Hi samet - thanks for reaching out about this. <span class="line"><!---->Hi samet - thanks for reaching out about this. <!----></span><br>The report you reference in comparison (<span class="line"><!---->The report you reference in comparison (<!----></span>issue 1201032<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032" title="Security: Use-After-Free in SelectFileDialog"><!---->issue 1201032<!----></a>) was awarded $25,000 because it was a report of five separate UAFs. It also required a second set of POCs to be provided, because as you can see in the original reward decision (<span class="line"><!---->) was awarded $25,000 because it was a report of five separate UAFs. It also required a second set of POCs to be provided, because as you can see in the original reward decision (<!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032#c38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032#c38"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032#c38<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> the VRP Panel originally declined a reward due to the reliance on on direct access to dev tools to trigger those UAF bugs. The researcher provided a whole new set of POCs that demonstrated these vulnerabilities being triggered via an extension and remote content without the direct access to dev tools. For this new set of reports and POCs they were extended a $25,000 reward. <span class="line"><!----> the VRP Panel originally declined a reward due to the reliance on on direct access to dev tools to trigger those UAF bugs. The researcher provided a whole new set of POCs that demonstrated these vulnerabilities being triggered via an extension and remote content without the direct access to dev tools. For this new set of reports and POCs they were extended a $25,000 reward. <!----></span><br><br>For this case, <span class="line"><!---->For this case, <!----></span>comment #34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->comment #34<!----></a> clearly explains the reward judgement. <span class="line"><!----> clearly explains the reward judgement. <!----></span><br>For UAFs and other memory corruption in the browser process, we generally reward between $15,000 to $30,000 for bugs that can be exploited via remote content and without requiring direct access to dev tools or series of user interactions such as though accessibility and debug consoles as required with this bug. <span class="line"><!---->For UAFs and other memory corruption in the browser process, we generally reward between $15,000 to $30,000 for bugs that can be exploited via remote content and without requiring direct access to dev tools or series of user interactions such as though accessibility and debug consoles as required with this bug. <!----></span><br>As has always been communicated in our VRP rules, "The amounts listed are for good quality reports that don't require complex or unlikely user interaction." <span class="line"><!---->As has always been communicated in our VRP rules, "The amounts listed are for good quality reports that don't require complex or unlikely user interaction." <!----></span><br><br>As there has been a trend away from reports of issues that can be exploited by remote content and more toward reports for issues that have a strong or sole dependency on user interaction, we have needed to update our policies and rules in order to reflect our priorities for impactful bug reports. This was also directly communicated to the researcher community in February via email: <span class="line"><!---->As there has been a trend away from reports of issues that can be exploited by remote content and more toward reports for issues that have a strong or sole dependency on user interaction, we have needed to update our policies and rules in order to reflect our priorities for impactful bug reports. This was also directly communicated to the researcher community in February via email: <!----></span><br>"Reports of issues that rely heavily or solely on user interaction, instead of being triggered by remote content, will generally receive significantly reduced rewards. Less convincing or more constrained bug submissions will likely qualify for reduced reward amounts, as chosen at the discretion of the reward panel."<span class="line"><!---->"Reports of issues that rely heavily or solely on user interaction, instead of being triggered by remote content, will generally receive significantly reduced rewards. Less convincing or more constrained bug submissions will likely qualify for reduced reward amounts, as chosen at the discretion of the reward panel."<!----></span><br><br>We - the VRP Panel on behalf of Chrome Security-  need to prioritize the issues that have the most impact to our users and can be most damaging when used by an attacker. Memory corruption issues are very harmful and impactful when they can be easily and covertly exploited by an attacker and provide the attacker control once the issue has been triggered. Thus, we have updated our VRP rules and reward policies to reflect this prioritization. <span class="line"><!---->We - the VRP Panel on behalf of Chrome Security-  need to prioritize the issues that have the most impact to our users and can be most damaging when used by an attacker. Memory corruption issues are very harmful and impactful when they can be easily and covertly exploited by an attacker and provide the attacker control once the issue has been triggered. Thus, we have updated our VRP rules and reward policies to reflect this prioritization. <!----></span><br><br>At the time this was rewarded, based on the information presented, an exceptional amount of unusual user interaction is required to trigger this issue. Not only is it unlikely a user can be reasonably convinced to follow these steps, but even if an attacker could convince the user to do so, there is still limited exploitation potential and they would be left with little control to exploit this issue to meaningful ends. <span class="line"><!---->At the time this was rewarded, based on the information presented, an exceptional amount of unusual user interaction is required to trigger this issue. Not only is it unlikely a user can be reasonably convinced to follow these steps, but even if an attacker could convince the user to do so, there is still limited exploitation potential and they would be left with little control to exploit this issue to meaningful ends. <!----></span><br><br>Comment #34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->Comment #34<!----></a> also provided an open invitation to the original researcher to provide further analysis or a new POC or other demonstration requiring less user interaction or improved exploitation potential. Had we would have received such, we would have happily reassessed the issue and provided a reward, similar to the process in <span class="line"><!----> also provided an open invitation to the original researcher to provide further analysis or a new POC or other demonstration requiring less user interaction or improved exploitation potential. Had we would have received such, we would have happily reassessed the issue and provided a reward, similar to the process in <!----></span>issue 1201032<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032" title="Security: Use-After-Free in SelectFileDialog"><!---->issue 1201032<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 43<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270095#c43">Comment 43<!----></a>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;

          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    s<kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!----> fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:         Looks like the steps are:<span class="line"><!---->Looks like the steps are:<!----></span><br>1. Load chrome://accessibility<span class="line"><!---->1. Load chrome://accessibility<!----></span><br>2. Check  web accessibility<span class="line"><!---->2. Check  web accessibility<!----></span><br>3. Rapidly repeatedly toggle the native a11y API support checkbox <span class="line"><!---->3. Rapidly repeatedly toggle the native a11y API support checkbox <!----></span><br><br>It doesn't make a lot of sense to consider chrome:// crashes as actual security vulnerabilities.<span class="line"><!---->It doesn't make a lot of sense to consider chrome:// crashes as actual security vulnerabilities.<!----></span><br>You can't inject code into them, link to them from another page, or load them remotely. A user would have to manually go to that page themselves.<span class="line"><!---->You can't inject code into them, link to them from another page, or load them remotely. A user would have to manually go to that page themselves.<!----></span><br><br>That said, thanks for the bug and we will address by having it manually force a safe crash in this case (where the a11y messaging system gets confused).<span class="line"><!---->That said, thanks for the bug and we will address by having it manually force a safe crash in this case (where the a11y messaging system gets confused).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

feature<!----></span><br>such as the event recorder is used.<span class="line"><!---->such as the event recorder is used.<!----></span><br><br>There is an benefit of this approach: any AccessibilityFatalError()<span class="line"><!---->There is an benefit of this approach: any AccessibilityFatalError()<!----></span><br>that occurs during content_browsertests or after a developer has used<span class="line"><!---->that occurs during content_browsertests or after a developer has used<!----></span><br>chrome://accessibility will crash immediately.<span class="line"><!---->chrome://accessibility will crash immediately.<!----></span><br>Better to crash immediately than to try to swallow bad serializations.<span class="line"><!---->Better to crash immediately than to try to swallow bad serializations.<!----></span><br>Note that the fail fast flag is purposely kept on, because using<span class="line"><!---->Note that the fail fast flag is purposely kept on, because using<!----></span><br>chrome://accessibility shows that the user is a developer.<span class="line"><!---->chrome://accessibility shows that the user is a         Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!           Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          (was: Assigned)

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Medium
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We consider browser process use-after-free to be Critical, but if it requires "unusual or unlikely user interaction" we consider the severity to be mitigated down by one or two levels. I'm therefore going to rate this Security_Severity-Medium.<span class="line"><!---->We consider browser process use-after-free to be Critical, but if it requires "unusual or unlikely user interaction" we consider the severity to be mitigated down by one or two levels. I'm therefore going to rate this Security_Severity-Medium.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270095#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jan 13, 2022, 7:19 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        Hello, this reward amount was not determine solely because there was no POC or reproduction, but also because <span class="line"><!---->Hello, this reward amount was not determine solely because there was no POC or reproduction, but also because <!----></span><br>1) this bug does not appear to be reachable from the web and triggering it would require considerable amount of UI gesture<span class="line"><!---->1) this bug does not appear to be reachable from the web and triggering it would require considerable amount of UI gesture<!----></span><br>2) the amount of UI gesture is quite exception and unusable, the chances of an attacker convincing a user to engage with the UI in this way to exploit this bug seem very low <span class="line"><!---->2) the amount of UI gesture is quite exception and unusable, the chances of an attacker convincing a user to engage with the UI in this way to exploit this bug seem very low <!----></span><br>3) there would be very limited attacker control to exploit this issue, so with the very low exploitability potential, the reward extended is much lower<span class="line"><!---->3) there would be very limited attacker control to exploit this issue, so with the very low exploitability potential, the reward extended is much lower<!----></span><br><br>If you can provide a POC that displays a way to trigger and exploit this issue without exception UI gesture and demonstrate greater control of this vulnerability, we would be happy to revisit this issue and reassess the reward amount.<span class="line"><!---->If you can provide a POC that displays a way to trigger and exploit this issue without exception UI gesture and demonstrate greater control of this vulnerability, we would be happy to revisit this issue and reassess the reward amount.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Hi samet - thanks for reaching out about this. <span class="line"><!---->Hi samet - thanks for reaching out about this. <!----></span><br>The report you reference in comparison (<span class="line"><!---->The report you reference in comparison (<!----></span>issue 1201032<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032" title="Security: Use-After-Free in SelectFileDialog"><!---->issue 1201032<!----></a>) was awarded $25,000 because it was a report of five separate UAFs. It also required a second set of POCs to be provided, because as you can see in the original reward decision (<span class="line"><!---->) was awarded $25,000 because it was a report of five separate UAFs. It also required a second set of POCs to be provided, because as you can see in the original reward decision (<!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032#c38<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032#c38"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032#c38<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> the VRP Panel originally declined a reward due to the reliance on on direct access to dev tools to trigger those UAF bugs. The researcher provided a whole new set of POCs that demonstrated these vulnerabilities being triggered via an extension and remote content without the direct access to dev tools. For this new set of reports and POCs they were extended a $25,000 reward. <span class="line"><!----> the VRP Panel originally declined a reward due to the reliance on on direct access to dev tools to trigger those UAF bugs. The researcher provided a whole new set of POCs that demonstrated these vulnerabilities being triggered via an extension and remote content without the direct access to dev tools. For this new set of reports and POCs they were extended a $25,000 reward. <!----></span><br><br>For this case, <span class="line"><!---->For this case, <!----></span>comment #34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->comment #34<!----></a> clearly explains the reward judgement. <span class="line"><!----> clearly explains the reward judgement. <!----></span><br>For UAFs and other memory corruption in the browser process, we generally reward between $15,000 to $30,000 for bugs that can be exploited via remote content and without requiring direct access to dev tools or series of user interactions such as though accessibility and debug consoles as required with this bug. <span class="line"><!---->For UAFs and other memory corruption in the browser process, we generally reward between $15,000 to $30,000 for bugs that can be exploited via remote content and without requiring direct access to dev tools or series of user interactions such as though accessibility and debug consoles as required with this bug. <!----></span><br>As has always been communicated in our VRP rules, "The amounts listed are for good quality reports that don't require complex or unlikely user interaction." <span class="line"><!---->As has always been communicated in our VRP rules, "The amounts listed are for good quality reports that don't require complex or unlikely user interaction." <!----></span><br><br>As there has been a trend away from reports of issues that can be exploited by remote content and more toward reports for issues that have a strong or sole dependency on user interaction, we have needed to update our policies and rules in order to reflect our priorities for impactful bug reports. This was also directly communicated to the researcher community in February via email: <span class="line"><!---->As there has been a trend away from reports of issues that can be exploited by remote content and more toward reports for issues that have a strong or sole dependency on user interaction, we have needed to update our policies and rules in order to reflect our priorities for impactful bug reports. This was also directly communicated to the researcher community in February via email: <!----></span><br>"Reports of issues that rely heavily or solely on user interaction, instead of being triggered by remote content, will generally receive significantly reduced rewards. Less convincing or more constrained bug submissions will likely qualify for reduced reward amounts, as chosen at the discretion of the reward panel."<span class="line"><!---->"Reports of issues that rely heavily or solely on user interaction, instead of being triggered by remote content, will generally receive significantly reduced rewards. Less convincing or more constrained bug submissions will likely qualify for reduced reward amounts, as chosen at the discretion of the reward panel."<!----></span><br><br>We - the VRP Panel on behalf of Chrome Security-  need to prioritize the issues that have the most impact to our users and can be most damaging when used by an attacker. Memory corruption issues are very harmful and impactful when they can be easily and covertly exploited by an attacker and provide the attacker control once the issue has been triggered. Thus, we have updated our VRP rules and reward policies to reflect this prioritization. <span class="line"><!---->We - the VRP Panel on behalf of Chrome Security-  need to prioritize the issues that have the most impact to our users and can be most damaging when used by an attacker. Memory corruption issues are very harmful and impactful when they can be easily and covertly exploited by an attacker and provide the attacker control once the issue has been triggered. Thus, we have updated our VRP rules and reward policies to reflect this prioritization. <!----></span><br><br>At the time this was rewarded, based on the information presented, an exceptional amount of unusual user interaction is required to trigger this issue. Not only is it unlikely a user can be reasonably convinced to follow these steps, but even if an attacker could convince the user to do so, there is still limited exploitation potential and they would be left with little control to exploit this issue to meaningful ends. <span class="line"><!---->At the time this was rewarded, based on the information presented, an exceptional amount of unusual user interaction is required to trigger this issue. Not only is it unlikely a user can be reasonably convinced to follow these steps, but even if an attacker could convince the user to do so, there is still limited exploitation potential and they would be left with little control to exploit this issue to meaningful ends. <!----></span><br><br>Comment #34<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c34"><!---->Comment #34<!----></a> also provided an open invitation to the original researcher to provide further analysis or a new POC or other demonstration requiring less user interaction or improved exploitation potential. Had we would have received such, we would have happily reassessed the issue and provided a reward, similar to the process in <span class="line"><!----> also provided an open invitation to the original researcher to provide further analysis or a new POC or other demonstration requiring less user interaction or improved exploitation potential. Had we would have received such, we would have happily reassessed the issue and provided a reward, similar to the process in <!----></span>issue 1201032<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201032" title="Security: Use-After-Free in SelectFileDialog"><!---->issue 1201032<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        }

          padding: 0;

        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;

          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>
